title: Yahoo Lifestyle
text: Republican Southern Grandma: The president complaining about corruption in government is like hearing Al Capone complaining about mob activity in Chicago. The only corruption Trump hates is the one he’s not involved in. When you shake Trump's hand and let it go, make sure to count your fingers. Trump’s kids are no different and they are really busy making money from the influence and power of the presidency. Jared and Ivanka made $82 million last year while working at the WH. They have no experience. Ivanka won approval for 16 brand new “expedited” trademarks from the Chinese government last month. The newest Chinese trademarks cover fashion items including handbags, shoes, wedding dresses, and jewelry" - (to be manufactured in China – “NOT MADE IN AMERICA”). Since Jared entered the White House, his family has courted state-connected investors in China and the Middle East — both regions that were in Kushner’s government portfolio — to bail out the firm’s headquarters at 666 Fifth Ave. in New York City. Jared Kushner met with senior officers of the Anbang investment operation in China “with a view to get hundreds of millions of dollars to rescue his desperately failing project on Fifth Avenue." Kushner’s family members solicited Chinese investment in Beijing in 2017 with a presentation including photos of their very own White House adviser and the president — and promises that Chinese could get special U.S. investor visas if they pumped money in the Kushner family Last year, Donald Jr. visited India to sell condos at future Trump-branded towers, appearing at an event that also featured India’s prime minister. In August, Donald Jr. flew to Jakarta to help kick-start sales at a pair of Trump-branded luxury resorts planned for Indonesia. China gave $500M to a Trump project in Indonesia being overseen by Don Jr. & Eric. They appeared at a private event with wealthy prospective buyers and joined his politically connected billionaire Indonesian business partner at a news conference. “They are criticizing the vice president’s son for doing exactly what they are doing themselves,” said a member of the Aberdeenshire Council in Scotland, which voted last month to approve a proposal by the Trumps to build a 500-unit housing development. “They are conducting international business here in Scotland.” This is the largest real estate development financed by the Trump Organization since the 2016 election.
